data.title: Fahrenheit 11/9 (2018)
data.summary: Michael Moore's "Fahrenheit 11/9" is a provocative and comedic look at the times in which we live. It will explore the two most important questions of the Trump Era: How the f**k did we get here, and how the f**k do we get out?

data.title: Pistorius (2018)

data.title: Active Measures (2018)
data.summary: Russian president Vladimir Putin attacks the 2016 American presidential election in collaboration with the Trump campaign.

data.title: Won't You Be My Neighbor? (2018)
data.summary: An exploration of the life, lessons, and legacy of iconic children's television host, Fred Rogers.

data.title: Free Solo (2018)
data.summary: Follow Alex Honnold as he becomes the first person to ever free solo climb Yosemite's 3,000ft high El Capitan Wall. With no ropes or safety gear, he completed arguably the greatest feat in rock climbing history.

data.title: Three Identical Strangers (2018)
data.summary: In 1980 New York, three young men who were all adopted meet each other and find out they're triplets who were separated at birth. Then they discover why.

data.summary: The exceptional life and career of U.S. Supreme Court Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg, who has developed a breathtaking legal legacy while becoming an unexpected pop culture icon.

data.title: Hunt For The Skinwalker (2018)
data.summary: Hunt For The Skinwalker is a documentary about the most intensive scientific study of a UFO and paranormal hotspot in human history.

data.title: Death of a Nation (2018)
data.summary: This documentary draws parallels between the dramatic fracturing of the nation over Abraham Lincoln's presidency and the presidency of Donald Trump.

data.title: Hot Girls Wanted (2015)
data.summary: A documentary about young women who have been drawn into the sex trade - and how easy it is for a web-savvy generation to end up making porn.

data.title: McQueen (2018)
data.summary: The life and career of fashion designer Lee Alexander McQueen: from his start as a tailor, to launching and overseeing his eponymous line, and his untimely death.

data.summary: The history of Dawson City, the gold rush town that had a historical treasure of forgotten silent films buried in permafrost for decades until 1978.

data.summary: An in-depth look at the life and music of Whitney Houston.

data.title: Fahrenheit 9/11 (2004)
data.summary: Michael Moore's view on what happened to the United States after September 11; and how the Bush Administration allegedly used the tragic event to push forward its agenda for unjust wars in Afghanistan and Iraq.

data.summary: A behind-the-scene account of the porn world and its stars as they've never been seen before - and the no-holds-barred portrait of a true giant.

data.summary: A documentary centered on a young man in Spain who claims to a grieving Texas family that he is their 16-year-old son who has been missing for 3 years.

data.summary: NUDE explores perceptions of nudity in art by chronicling the creative process of photographer David Bellemere as he's commissioned by NU Muses founder Steve Shaw to shoot a fine art calendar of nude photographs.

data.summary: Using hidden cameras and never-before-seen footage, Earthlings chronicles the day-to-day practices of the largest industries in the world, all of which rely entirely on animals for profit.

data.summary: This documentary explores Kratom, a botanical supplement that has been proposed as an alternative to today's opioid painkillers.

data.summary: A man searches for answers to Donald Trump's widespread support before the 2016 presidential election.

data.summary: A deep historical look at one of the most controversial issues of our time, highlighting the abortion debate from various points along the ideological spectrum in a winding story of abortion in America.

data.summary: Father Gabriele Amorth performs his ninth exorcism on an Italian woman.

data.title: Grey Gardens (1975)
data.summary: An old mother and her middle-aged daughter, the aunt and cousin of Jacqueline Kennedy, live their eccentric lives in a filthy, decaying mansion in East Hampton.

data.title: The Magic Pill (2017)
data.summary: People around the globe are combating illness through a paradigm shift in eating. And this simple change -- embracing fat as our main fuel -- is showing profound promise in improving the health of people, animals and the planet.

data.title: Samsara (I) (2011)
data.summary: Filmed over nearly five years in twenty-five countries on five continents, and shot on seventy-millimetre film, Samsara transports us to the varied worlds of sacred grounds, disaster zones, industrial complexes, and natural wonders.

data.summary: To learn what the USA can learn from other nations, Michael Moore playfully "invades" them to see what they have to offer.

data.title: Beware the Slenderman (2016)

data.summary: While examining the influence of the fast food industry, Morgan Spurlock personally explores the consequences on his health of a diet of solely McDonald's food for one month.

data.title: Baraka (1992)
data.summary: A collection of expertly photographed scenes of human life and religion.

data.title: This Changes Everything (2018)
data.summary: An investigative look and analysis of gender disparity in Hollywood, featuring accounts from well-known actors, executives and artists in the Industry.

data.title: Bisbee '17 (2018)
data.summary: An old mining town on the Arizona-Mexico border finally reckons with its darkest day: the deportation of 1200 immigrant miners exactly 100 years ago. Locals collaborate to stage recreations of their controversial past.

data.summary: Nine high school students from disparate corners of the globe navigate rivalries, setbacks, and hormones on their quest to win the international science fair. Only one can be named "Best in Fair."

data.summary: A documentary comparing the highly profitable American health care industry to other nations, and HMO horror stories including shotgun deaths.

data.summary: A filmmaker decides to memorialize a murdered friend when his friend's ex-girlfriend announces she is expecting his son.

data.summary: A documentary looking at the inner-workings of the Church of Scientology.

data.summary: An intrepid filmmaker on a journey of discovery as he uncovers possibly the largest health secret of our time and the collusion between industry, government, pharmaceutical and health organizations keeping this information from us.

data.summary: A group of Israelis and Palestinians come together in Oslo for an unsanctioned peace talks during the 1990s in order to bring peace to the Middle East.

data.summary: A story of a sniper fighting for the pro-Russian rebels in Eastern Ukraine.

data.title: I Am Not Your Negro (2016)
data.summary: Writer James Baldwin tells the story of race in modern America with his unfinished novel, Remember This House.
